main event: On 17 November 1957, a sighting occurred at 11:00Z, lasting 45-60 minutes, with photographs taken. The object changed from round to egg shape, was white and silver, and oscillated sideways on a horizontal round light red in color.
interesting points: The object was observed changing shape and oscillating sideways on a round light red in color.
The sighting lasted for a considerable amount of time, allowing for extensive observation.
Photographs were taken as evidence of the sighting.
The conclusion was marked as 'unidentified' despite speculation that it could be a high-altitude balloon.
The report suggests that the object could vary in altitude, indicating advanced maneuverability.
sighted object: object changing from round to egg shape, white and silver, oscillating sideways on a round light red in color
